arm_group.description:
A central pharmacy will compound a placebo to match the metformin tablets.
The placebo product will contain the following components:
Micosolle™, silica based excipient
Silicified Micro Crystalline Cellulose, National Formulary
Safflower Oil, United States Pharmacopeia
K-30 Povidone Powder
Magnesium Stearate, National Formulary (Vegetable source)
Fumed Silica, National Formulary

brief_summary.textblock:
Insulin Clamp Ancillary study for Assessment of Insulin Resistance will be conducted as a
      sub-study to the main protocol, Metformin Therapy for Overweight Adolescents With Type 1
      Diabetes (NCT01881828). The purpose of this ancillary study is to assess if metformin will
      improve tissue-specific insulin resistance (IR) in type 1 diabetes using a hyperinsulinemic
      euglycemic clamp; a 6-month randomized trial comparing metformin versus placebo in 12 to <20
      year olds with BMI >85th percentile ( total daily insulin dose >0.8 units/kg, and HbA1c
      7.5%-9.9%).

clinical_study.brief_title: Insulin Clamp Ancillary Study for Assessment of Insulin Resistance

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        1. Meets eligibility criteria of the main study, Metformin Therapy for Overweight
        Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes (NCT01881828).

        Exclusion Criteria:

        1. Low hemoglobin or hematocrit as defined by each local institution's rules for insulin
        clamps or if no institutional requirements a Hematocrit <30% or hemoglobin <10 gm/dL

intervention.description: The strength of each tablet will be 500 mg. Participants will build up to a daily dose over four weeks by taking one tablet per day for 7 days, one tablet twice daily for 7 days, one tablet in the morning and 2 tablets at night for 7 days, and then 2 tablets in the morning and 2 tablets at night, daily throughout the remainder of the study treatment period.

clinical_study.official_title: Metformin Therapy for Overweight Adolescents With Type 1 Diabetes (T1D)--Insulin Clamp Ancillary Study for Assessment of Insulin Resistance

overall_official.affiliation: Childrens Hospital of University of Pittsburgh Medical Center
University of Colorado Denver/Childrens Hospital Colorado

primary_outcome.description: Hyperinsulinemic euglycemic clamp to assess metformin's impact on muscle IR via glucose infusion rate (GIR).
primary_outcome.measure: Change in insulin resistance (IR) from baseline to 13 weeks

secondary_outcome.description:
Graded hyperinsulinemic euglycemic clamp with glucose and glycerol isotopes to assess metformin's impact on:
• Hepatic IR
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Hepatic IR from baseline to 13 weeks

secondary_outcome.description:
Graded hyperinsulinemic euglycemic clamp with glucose and glycerol isotopes to assess metformin's impact on:
• Adipose IR
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Adipose IR from baseline to 13 weeks
